titles.title: Calling for the United States to propose and seek an international embargo against the totalitarian government of Cuba.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Referred to the Subcommittee on International Economic Policy and Trade.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Western Hemisphere.

bill.summary: 2/7/1995--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) the United States considers the acts of the Castro government, including its violations of human rights, a threat to international peace; and (2) the President should instruct U.S. representatives to the United Nations Security Council to seek an international embargo against the totalitarian government of Cuba.
